item.title: Is 1 Tbps The Next Optical Network Standard?
item.description:
While everyday users are getting used to 100 Mbps speeds, network providers are already looking ahead to Terabit per second speeds, debating whether 400 Gbps or 1 Tbps will be the next standard. This push for higher speeds is a natural progression, similar to the advancement from Kbps to Mbps and Gbps. Just like previous upgrades, the proposed standards represent a tenfold increase. This speed increase mirrors Moore’s Law, which predicted the doubling of transistors on integrated circuits yearly...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/is-1-tbps-the-next-optical-network-standard/

item.title: Ethernet WAN to Complement Your LAN
item.description:
By: John Shepler Your company’s Local Area Network (LAN) likely operates at blazing speeds of 1 Gbps or more, making internal network operations seem almost instantaneous. However, accessing resources outside your physical location can feel painstakingly slow. Wouldn’t it be convenient if your LAN could extend across cities or even to remote offices? You might be surprised to learn that this is a possibility. Yes, The WAN is Ethernet Networks can be broadly categorized as either owned or leased...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/ethernet-wan-to-complement-your-lan/
